alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 25 at 8:52PM EST until January 28 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
